abstract.p: Antonio Lopez letter urges fellow Cuban-Americans like Oscar Hijuelos (June 29 Op-Ed) to abandon sloganeering and address political reasons behind Cuban national rift (S)

block.p: Re ''An Ending, but Not a Happy One'' (Op-Ed, June 29):

Re ''An Ending, but Not a Happy One'' (Op-Ed, June 29):
Like Oscar Hijuelos, I grew up in a Cuban-American home and witnessed firsthand the ''triumph'' of exiled life. But we disagree on one important matter.

Mr. Hijuelos's view of the exile cause as noble, sincere and filled with the ''best intentions'' for Elian Gonzalez is a mystifying simplification of Cuban reality. Couldn't these very traits be attributed to the most fervent of revolutionaries in Cuba?

If one wishes to foster true reconciliation between Cubans here and there, one must abandon sloganeering and instead address the political reasons behind the Cuban national rift. Mr. Hijuelos compares the struggle between Cubans on the island and Cuban exiles to a ''corrida'' -- a bullfight. In fact, it is a history of bad policy, in the United States and in Cuba, that keeps Cubans apart, not the workings of some cosmic corrida.
